episodeTitle: Wanted Posters Make It Around The World! Celebration In Their Hometowns As The Ship Moves Forward!
episodeTitleJapanese: めぐる手配書！故郷は踊る船は進む！
episodeTitleRomanized: Meguru Tehaisho! Kokyō wa Odoru Fune wa Susumu!
description: The Straw Hat Pirates officially name their new ship the Thousand Sunny and escape from Vice Admiral Garp using Franky's Coup de Burst. Meanwhile, the crew's updated bounty posters circulate around the world, reaching their hometowns and causing various reactions from friends, family, and allies.

events.title: Thousand Sunny Officially Named
events.description: Before departing Water 7, the Straw Hat crew officially names their new ship the 'Thousand Sunny' after various humorous suggestions. Iceburg proposes the name combining the concepts of sailing a thousand seas like the sun, and the entire crew approves.
events.significance: The official christening of the Straw Hat Pirates' second ship, which becomes their home for the rest of the series. This marks the end of their time at Water 7 and the beginning of a new chapter.

quotes.text: If you were a pirate, you'd sail a thousand seas like the sun! The Thousand Sunny!
quotes.speaker: Iceburg
quotes.context: Iceburg suggests the name for the new ship

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's rejected name suggestion for the ship

events.title: First Use of Coup de Burst
events.description: Under attack from Vice Admiral Garp's massive cannonball, Franky activates the Thousand Sunny's secret emergency acceleration device called 'Coup de Burst.' The ship uses three barrels of cola to fire a giant cannon downward, rocketing the ship one kilometer into the air and enabling their escape.
events.significance: The debut of the Thousand Sunny's signature escape technique, which becomes crucial in many future dangerous situations. Demonstrates Franky's genius shipbuilding and the ship's advanced capabilities.

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky activates the emergency acceleration device for the first time

events.title: Straw Hats Escape from Garp
events.description: Using the Coup de Burst, the Thousand Sunny successfully escapes Vice Admiral Garp's attack and Water 7, flying through the air to evade the powerful Marine. The crew celebrates their reunion and new ship as they head toward Fish-Man Island.
events.significance: Marks the successful departure from Water 7 and the end of the Water 7 Saga. The crew is finally reunited with all members including Usopp and their new shipwright Franky.

events.title: Post-Enies Lobby Bounties Circulate Worldwide
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates' updated bounty posters begin circulating around the world following the Enies Lobby incident. Luffy's bounty increases to 300,000,000 berries, Zoro to 120,000,000, Robin to 80,000,000, Sanji to 77,000,000, and Sogeking (Usopp) to 30,000,000. Chopper receives a mere 50 berries as he's mistaken for a pet.
events.significance: Represents the crew's growing threat level to the World Government and their rising fame. The bounty increases reflect their victory at Enies Lobby and mark them as serious contenders in the pirate world.

events.title: Foosha Village Celebrates Luffy's Bounty
events.description: In Foosha Village, Luffy's hometown, the villagers celebrate his increased bounty with pride and joy. Makino comments positively on Luffy's crew, particularly noting Chopper as cute. Mayor Woop Slap expresses frustration that a criminal came from their village and wonders what Garp is doing about it.
events.significance: Shows how Luffy's actions affect his hometown and the conflicting reactions to his pirate status. Demonstrates the village's continued support despite him being a wanted criminal.

quotes.text: I like his crew, especially his cute pet!
quotes.speaker: Makino
quotes.context: Makino commenting on Chopper while looking at the bounty posters

events.title: Syrup Village Recognizes Sogeking as Usopp
events.description: In Syrup Village, Kaya and the Usopp Pirates (Ninjin, Piiman, and Tamanegi) immediately recognize that Sogeking is actually Usopp due to his distinctive long nose, despite the mask. They approve of his masked appearance and celebrate his bounty.
events.significance: Demonstrates that those who know Usopp well can easily see through his Sogeking disguise, adding humor to his attempt at a secret identity.

events.title: Zoro's Dojo Receives His Bounty
events.description: At Zoro's former dojo, his old sensei receives Zoro's new bounty poster showing 120,000,000 berries. The sensei expresses happiness for Zoro's success while advising his students not to use Zoro as a role model since he's now a wanted criminal.
events.significance: Shows the mixed emotions of Zoro's mentor - pride in his student's strength but concern about his criminal path.

events.title: Genzo's Reaction to Nami's Bounty Poster
events.description: In Cocoyashi Village, Genzo receives Nami's bounty poster and objects that it's 'too lewd,' yet displays it prominently anyway. Nojiko observes that Nami looks genuinely happy in the photo, understanding that she's found her true place with the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Demonstrates Genzo's protective father-figure nature toward Nami while Nojiko recognizes her sister's genuine happiness with her crew.

events.title: Dr. Kureha and Dalton See Chopper's Bounty
events.description: On Drum Island (now Sakura Kingdom), Dr. Kureha and King Dalton receive Chopper's bounty poster showing a mere 50 berries. Despite the insulting low amount, Kureha is pleased to see Chopper's face again and know he's doing well.
events.significance: Shows Kureha's maternal affection for Chopper and her pride in seeing him adventure with his crew, even if the World Government doesn't recognize his true threat level.

events.title: Baratie Mocks Sanji's Wanted Poster
events.description: At the Baratie restaurant, Zeff and the former chefs immediately recognize the terrible composite sketch as Sanji despite it looking nothing like him. They laugh at the poor artwork but proudly display it as the centerpiece of the restaurant, using it as a selling point and handing out free copies to customers, bragging that 'Black Leg' Sanji grew up there.
events.significance: Demonstrates Zeff and the Baratie crew's pride in Sanji despite his wanted status. The poor photo quality becomes a running gag throughout the series.

events.title: Vivi Learns Robin is with the Straw Hats
events.description: In Arabasta, King Cobra, Igaram, Chaka, and Pell are shocked to learn that Nico Robin (formerly Miss All Sunday of Baroque Works) is affiliated with the Straw Hat Pirates. They worry about Princess Vivi's reaction, but she already knows and trusts Luffy's judgment completely.
events.significance: Demonstrates Vivi's complete trust in Luffy despite Robin's former role as their enemy. Shows character growth and the bonds formed during the Arabasta arc.

quotes.text: There was no way to know just what is inside Luffy's head.
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi's response to learning Robin is with the Straw Hats

events.title: Dragon Sees Luffy's New Bounty
events.description: At Baltigo, the Revolutionary Army headquarters, Terry Gilteo (an intelligence officer) sorts through bounty posters. Monkey D. Dragon, leader of the Revolutionary Army and Luffy's father, sees the Straw Hats' wanted posters and believes his son's actions will cause people to question the World Government.
events.significance: First appearance of Dragon since Loguetown. Establishes Dragon's awareness of Luffy's progress and hints at how the Revolutionary Army views the Straw Hats' actions against the World Government. Sets up future connections between Luffy and the Revolutionary Army.

events.title: Terry Gilteo Debut
events.description: Terry Gilteo, an intelligence controller for the Revolutionary Army, appears for the first time. He is shown sorting through bounty posters at Baltigo and briefing Dragon about Luffy's exploits.
events.significance: Introduction of a Revolutionary Army member, establishing the organization's intelligence operations and their interest in the Straw Hats.

events.title: Smoker Vows to Defeat the Straw Hats
events.description: On an island in the Grand Line, Smoker and Tashigi receive the new bounty posters. Despite having just caught a pirate worth 50,000,000 berries, Smoker expresses frustration and declares he will crush the Straw Hats when they meet in the New World, betting his pride on their defeat.
events.significance: Continues Smoker's ongoing rivalry with Luffy and sets up future confrontations. Shows his determination to bring the Straw Hats to justice.

quotes.text: I will crush the Straw Hats in the New World, betting my pride on it!
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker's vow after seeing the new bounties

events.title: Baltigo Location Debut
events.description: The island of Baltigo is shown for the first time as the secret headquarters of the Revolutionary Army. The location is shown to be where Dragon and his organization operate from.
events.significance: First reveal of the Revolutionary Army's base of operations, a critical location that becomes important to the overall story. This location remains secret to the World Government at this time.

quotes.text: If you were a pirate, you'd sail a thousand seas like the sun! The Thousand Sunny!
quotes.speaker: Iceburg
quotes.context: Naming the Straw Hats' new ship

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Activating the Thousand Sunny's emergency acceleration device

quotes.text: I like his crew, especially his cute pet!
quotes.speaker: Makino
quotes.context: Commenting on Chopper while viewing the bounty posters

quotes.text: There was no way to know just what is inside Luffy's head.
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi's response to learning Robin is with the Straw Hats

quotes.text: I will crush the Straw Hats in the New World, betting my pride on it!
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker's vow after seeing the new bounties

themes.description: The episode celebrates the continuation of the Straw Hats' journey with their new ship, representing their commitment to their dreams despite increased danger.
themes.symbolism: The Thousand Sunny represents a new beginning and the crew's determination to sail through any challenge, named to invoke the idea of endless adventure across a thousand seas.

themes.description: The worldwide reactions show the deep connections the Straw Hats have formed throughout their journey, with friends and allies celebrating their achievements.
themes.symbolism: The bounty posters spreading worldwide symbolize how the crew's influence and the bonds they've formed extend across the entire world.

themes.description: Dragon's appearance highlights the theme of inherited will and family legacy, as he observes his son following his own path of challenging the World Government.
themes.symbolism: Dragon seeing Luffy's bounty represents the passing of the torch between generations and the continuation of the fight against oppression.

characterSpotlights.development: Franky demonstrates his value to the crew by using the Thousand Sunny's Coup de Burst to save them from Garp, showcasing his genius engineering.
keyActions: Insists on naming the ship before departure
Activates Coup de Burst for the first time
Successfully escapes from Vice Admiral Garp

characterSpotlights.development: Dragon is shown monitoring Luffy's progress, believing his son's actions will inspire people to question the World Government.
keyActions: Reflects on Luffy's impact on the world

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's growing infamy is showcased through the reactions worldwide, demonstrating his increasing influence and the pride his friends feel.
keyActions: Suggests humorous names for the ship
Escapes from Garp with his crew

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the hometown reaction sequences with additional dialogue and scenes not present in the manga.
Additional comedic moments during the ship naming sequence were added in the anime.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode to use 'Crazy Rainbow' as the opening theme. The song was performed by Tackey & Tsubasa and ran from episodes 284-325.
Episode 324 adapted material from manga chapters 439 and 440, which also introduced the Blackbeard vs. Ace confrontation that would be shown in the following episode.
The Coup de Burst technique uses exactly three barrels of cola to launch the ship one kilometer into the air, establishing the Thousand Sunny's cola-based power system.
This episode marks the first time Baltigo, the Revolutionary Army headquarters, is shown in the anime, though its name and exact location remain secret.
Sanji's wanted poster features a poorly drawn composite sketch instead of a photograph, a running gag that continues throughout the series.
